Steps.Message: We became aware of a power cut at 08:00. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly.
Steps.Name: Power cut reported

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Engineers investigating and fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power restored

UKPNIncident.PlannedIncidentReason: The reason for this work is we are connecting a new street lamp to our electricity network. This work is at the request of a third party. Due to the type of electricity cables we need to make the connection to our engineers will need to temporarily switch off your power to ensure they can carry out this work safely. Also by carrying out these works at the request of a third party we are contributing to restarting the economy, along with keeping the area safe with outside light. This is why it is important to complete this during the coronavirus pandemic. This work is taking place on Sandown Road.
